Detailed Description

Represents the main window of the application.

Called only once by Application. By design, this is the only modeless window shown in the application. All other views are implemented as panels which are inserted into this frame using the SwapPanels method, which inserts the panel and resizes the window appropriately to the panel's preferred size.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

MainWindow::MainWindow ( bool  showInTaskbar = true  ) 

Creates the window frame with position/size stored in settings.

Parameters:
showInTaskbar if set to false, will hide window from the taskbar. this can only be done at construction.

void MainWindow::OnActivate ( wxActivateEvent &  evt  ) 

Handled when the window is activated or deactivated.

This usually matters when transparency settings are set to only apply when the window is inactive.

void MainWindow::OnClearPanel ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Handles the custom wxEVT_CLEAR_PANEL event to clear contents of a panel.

This event is posted from SwapPanels.

See also:
SwapPanels

Here is the call graph for this function:

void MainWindow::OnExit ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Handles clicking of the Exit menu item (or Ctrl+Q/Command+Q key combo).

Closes the main window which causes the application to exit.

void MainWindow::OnIconize ( wxIconizeEvent &  evt  ) 

Handles a minimize event.

If settings are set to minimize to tray, the window will be hidden here.

Here is the call graph for this function:

void MainWindow::OnLogout ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Handles clicking of the logout menu item.

Logs the user out and shows the login panel

void MainWindow::OnOptions ( wxCommandEvent &  evt  ) 

Handles the clicking of the options menu item (or accelerator Ctrl+O key, Command+Comma on OSX).

Shows the OptionsDialog and saves/updates application settings if the dialog is successfully closed.

void MainWindow::TrayNotification ( const wxString &  text,
const wxString &  title = _T("Twittle"),
const wxIcon *  icon = NULL,
int  delay = 5 
)

Shows a Tray notification (bubble); Currently implemented in Win32 only.

wxWidgets 2.9 has this functionality, but it is not yet released.

Parameters:
text the notification text
title the title of the notification
icon show an icon next to the notification (currently unused)
delay how long (in seconds) to show the notification
